dialog.text: The bottom half of the image is stone and sea. There is a diagonal line from the upper left (middle of the image) to the bottom right, splitting the stones (on the left, bottom) and the sea (on the right, top).
Are the lines (the horizon line and the diagonal) very straight or are they jagged? Is there anything within the rocks?
The horizontal line is pretty straight but the diagonal line is pretty jagged. On the top of the stones, there are some very small areas of river.
Where along the diagonal line are the patches of river? And what time of day does it appear to be in the image?
The patches of river is toward the left top end of the diagonal line. It is daytime with a clear cloudless sky.
Is there anything within the area of sea?
No. There is a mountain range right above the sea. The mountain is pretty low with a straight slope going down to the right.
How high does the top of the mountain reach on each side of the image?
On the left, the top goes up to almost two thirds of the image. From there, it slopes down straight to the right to almost just a bit above the sea.
Got it. Is there anything other than sky, mountain, sea, river, and stone?
Yes. In front of the mountain, there are some trees from the left, covering all of the mountain on the left, sloping downward and ending at one fourth of the width.
How tall are these trees? And do you mean one fourth from the right or from the left?
The trees start as high as the mountain but then slope down (steeper slope than the mountain's). They end at one fourth from the left.
Are there any peaks in the line of trees?
No. It is pretty flat on the top. Also, the trees are opposite - they should be on the left side with the mountain, ending one quarter of the width from the left.
So the trees form a triangle that covers the mountain on the left?
Exactly, the top of the triangle should be pretty flat though.
